comments:
Can be reproduced by evaluation of the following expression:

let b:Boolean = null in Bag{1}->forAll(b and b)



Stack trace:
java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.emf.ocl.types.impl.InvalidTypeImpl$1
	at org.eclipse.emf.ocl.expressions.impl.IterationTemplateForAll.evaluateResult(IterationTemplateForAll.java:40)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ocl.expressions.impl.IterationTemplate.evaluate(IterationTemplate.java:78)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ocl.expressions.impl.EvaluationVisitorImpl.evaluateForAllIterator(EvaluationVisitorImpl.java:1517)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ocl.expressions.impl.EvaluationVisitorImpl.visitIteratorExp(EvaluationVisitorImpl.java:1439)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ocl.expressions.impl.IteratorExpImpl.accept(IteratorExpImpl.java:60)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ocl.expressions.impl.EvaluationVisitorImpl.visitLetExp(EvaluationVisitorImpl.java:2102)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ocl.expressions.impl.LetExpImpl.accept(LetExpImpl.java:92)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ocl.query.impl.QueryImpl.evaluate(QueryImpl.java:224)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ocl.helper.OCLHelper.evaluate(OCLHelper.java:247)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ocl.helper.OCLHelper.evaluate(OCLHelper.java:264)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ocl.examples.interpreter.console.OCLConsolePage.evaluate(OCLConsolePage.java:245)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ocl.examples.interpreter.console.OCLConsolePage$InputKeyListener.keyPressed(OCLConsolePage.java:431)

Updated the 11 supported iterators to handle both null and OclInvalid values of their body expressions, as follows:

  - forAll, exists, one, any:  result of the iteration is OclInvalid if
    any evaluation of the body results in either null or OclInvalid
  - collect, collectNested, closure:  result of the iteration is OclInvalid
    if any evaluation of the body results in OclInvalid.  The null value is
    allowed in collections
  - select, reject, sortedBy:  result of the iteration is OclInvalid if
    any evaluation of the body results in either null or OclInvalid
  - isUnique:  unchanged, as both null and OclInvalid support the
   = and <> operations

Beware that this means that sometimes, now, iteration expressions will result in OclInvalid.  This will usually cascade so that the entire expression is OclInvalid (which is OCL's intent).
